question: The "Terracotta Army" is a part of the heritage of which nation?
explanation: Terracotta Army is a collection of terracotta sculptures unearthed during the excavation of the site "Mausoleum of the First Qin Emperor", which is itself a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It was discovered in 1974. This form of funerary art depicts the armies of Qin Shi Huang, the first Emperor of China. These sculptures are an example of realism and great heritage.
